topic.title: Planning installation and requirements
topic.shortdesc: Installation involves picking up the platform and the correct software edition for your needs, downloading the software, and running the installer.

ul.li: Review hardware requirements, supported platforms, network configuration, security considerations, and production deployment considerations.
Follow installation instructions for your operating system or cloud environment.

section.title: Minimum specification
section.p: Hardware and software requirements may vary depending on the machine and operating system.
The minimum hardware specifications to install and effectively operate Couchbase Server are:

ul.li: A block-based storage device (hard disk, SSD, EBS, iSCSI).

section.p: Network file systems such as CIFS and NFS are not supported.
section.note: You can reduce the CPU and RAM resources below the above-specified minimum for development and testing purposes. The specification can be as low as 1GB of free RAM beyond operating system requirements and a single CPU core. However, you must use at least the required minimum specification for production.

section.title: Recommended specifications
section.p: The recommended hardware specifications to install and effectively operate Couchbase Server include:

ul.li: Four core 64-bit x86 CPU running at 3GHz; six cores when using Cross Datacenter Replication (XDCR) and Views.
A local block-based storage device (hard disk, SSD). Network filesystems such as CIFS and NFS are not supported.
